free: #e Hello, I want to talk about a legendary story from long ago.
#c 大家好，我要說的是很久以前的祖先的傳說故事。
#e A long time ago, there was a legend that said there was a very lazy daughter-in-law who did work slowly.
#c 很久以前有一個傳說說，有那個懶惰的媳婦，做甚麼工作動作非常慢。
#e She had been chased away by her husband and turned in a bird on the road home.
#c 因為被丈夫休妻回[娘]家在路上變成鳥。
#e That’s how it is.
#c 是這樣的。
#e One day, there was a daughter-in-law.
#c 有一天 有一個媳婦。
#e The early Bunun people were very busy all the day when it was the season for harvesting millet.
#c 因為過去的人 布農族人，如果到了採收小米的季節，會從早到晚非常忙碌。
#e At midday they could not rest or eat.
#c 中午不能休息吃飯。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.斜格
使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格
做-使役<完成貌>在-家-處焦
free: #e Then, as for the master of the family of the daughter-in-law, because the daughter-in-law was lazy and slow, her in-laws made her stay at home.
#c 然後，屬於媳婦的那一家的主人，因為媳婦懶惰又動作很慢，他的婆婆公公把她放在家裡。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.斜格
做<完成貌>小米=遠距.斜格
free: #e Her mother-in-law told her “Today everybody is going to help out harvesting millet. So, you stay at home. You first have to prepare the evening meal for the people who are helping us harvesting millet.”
#c 她的媽媽對媳婦說：「今天在我們的家人家都會來幫忙收小米，然後，你就在家裡，你要先準備煮飯要給幫我們收小米的人吃晚餐。」

#e The mother-in-law helped her put two strings of millet on the floor, ordering two things: “Today you need to finish pounding millet and then cook them and wait for cousins that are harvesting millet.”
#c 那個媽媽幫他拿兩串的小米放在地上，交代這兩個事情︰「你這一天你要搗米，搗完米後要煮飯等採收小米的親戚哦！」
#e Her husband also went along with all of them to harvest millet.
#c 他的丈夫也是這樣一起去要收小米。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格

free: #e And the daughter-in-law really stayed at home, looking and saying: "Oh my God, two strings of millet to be pounded.”
#c 那個媳婦就真的留在家。她看著說:「 唉唷，有兩把要搗的小米。」
#e She was stomping the rice very slowly. However, because she was a very slow people, she didn’t finish it.
#c 她慢慢的踩稻舂米，但是因為她是一個很慢的人，所以她沒有搗完。
#e It already got to the noon but she hadn’t even finished stripping one string.
#c 正中午了，她連一把也沒剝完。

gloss: 非實現=主焦-煮=改變狀態
非實現=主焦-來=改變狀態

free: #e How was she going to have cooked if it was getting close to evening? she needed to finish pounding and cooking the rice because the harvesters were about coming. But what to do? it wasn’t finished.
#c 要怎麼辦？大約快要傍晚了，要結束了，因為要煮好搗好的米了，收小米的人要來了。還沒弄完怎麼辦？
#n us’up=in < us’upa=in、na=ma-pit’i=in < na=ma-pit’ia=in
#e She pounded the rice very strongly, but how?
#c 她很用力一直稻米，但怎麼？
#e Because the superlazy girl is completely over the top.
#c 因為超懶的女生太過分了。
#e And she works slowly.
#c 而且工作慢。
#e By the evening, she still hadn’t finished pounding one string of rice.
#c 傍晚，她還是沒搗完一把串米。
#n la-: 搗的意思, lamis, labutun, lalaun
#e The rice that mother had taken down.
#c 媽媽辦下來的米飯。

gloss: 做<完成貌>小米=遠距.主格
free: #e But then the people who were harvesting came home.
#c 可是那些收小米的人就回家了。
#e All of the people helping farming came home to eat.
#c 那些幫助的人都回家來吃飯。
#e And the mother came home.
#c 媽媽進到家裡了。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格
free: #e She kept shouting: where is the daughter-in-law?!
#c 她一直大喊大叫：媳婦在那裡？
#e Daughter-in-law, where is the food you were told to cook?
#c 媳婦,你為我們預備的飯在哪裡 ？
#e We the harvesters have come back.
#c 我們收小米的人回來了。

gloss: 做<完成貌>-小米=遠距.主格
free: #e We are all very hungry.
#c  全部收小米的人都很餓了。
#e Because the Bunun people from the past, when harvesting millet were not allowed to rest or eat.
#c 因為以前的布農人收小米的時候，不能休息吃飯 	。
#e You need to finish harvesting the millet of a the whole row, before you can co home and eat.
#c 一定要先完成收整個行列的小米，才可以回家吃飯。
#e When they got home, the mother saw that the stove was cold.
#c  當他們到家裡了，媽媽看到 爐灶是冷的。
#e There was no pot on the fire.
#c 沒有鍋子在廚房。
#e She went over and saw, ai, in the mortar the unpounded millet was hidden.
#c 她過去看，哎，臼裡面藏著未舂的小米！
#e What to eat? What was cooked then?
#c 要吃什麼，有什麼煮好了？
#e She called the daughter-in-law, who had been slacking around.
#c 她教過媳婦，結果她一直悠哉悠哉。
#n vala~vala as a reduplication? lexicalized ideophone?
#e Snoring while sleeping!
#c 呼呼地睡！
#e But doesn’t even know how to cook!
#c 可是不知道要煮飯咯！
#e The mother was very angry.
#c 媽媽非常的生氣。
#e The father, all the people who came to help, all were very angry.
#c 父親、幫忙的人，大家都很生氣。
#e They were very hungry, what to eat?
#c 他們非常飢餓，要吃什麼？
#e The mother was very angry.
#c 媽媽非常的生氣。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格

free: #e Get up, stand up, go away, hit the road!
#c 起來，起立，跑走啊，滾！
#e I don’t want you anymore!
#c 我不要你了！
#e Then she tells the husband:
#c 然後她對丈夫說：
#e “Chase off your wife!
#c “趕走你的太太！
#e Don’t let her stay in this house anymore!
#c 絕對不喲啊讓她留在這個家了！
#e What use is that girl? She is useless.”
#c 那個女生有什麼用？不能使用。”
#e That day she only made two strings of millet pulp for the millet harvesters to eat.
#c 那天她只搗出來兩串搗米給農小米的人來吃。
#e But she didn’t cook, didn’t finish pounding.
#c 但她沒有煮菜，沒有搗完。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格
free: #e The daughter-in-law was chased away by them.
#c 媳婦真的被他們趕走。
#e Then that night, she was driven away.
#c 那天晚上，他們趕走她。
#e The girl was thinking, how can I go?
#c 女生在想，我怎麼走？
#e Where to go?
#c 要去哪裡？
#e I don’t there going back home.
#c 不敢回到娘家。
#e In the past, if you were married,
#c 過去以前假如被娶，
#e you couldn’t go back to one's elderly home without reason.
#c 沒辦法無緣無故回娘家。
#e Except for when your parents would call you to come home.
#c 除非是父母親叫你回去。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格

free: #e The daughter-in-law was very sad, too ashamed to go home, because she was chased off?
#c 那個媳婦心理難過，害羞怎麼可以回娘家，我是被休妻的？
#e When she was about to leave, she cut millet stems for the last time.
#c 當她要走的時候，她最後一次切斷小米的莖
#e She bound them around her lower legs.
#c 她把他的小腿綁起來。
#e Because she was very skinny, and didn’t have any meat.
#c 因為那個女生很瘦，沒有肉。
#e So she put the millet stems around her legs.
#c 她把小米莖綁在小腿部。
#e She bound them into a shin pads.
#c 把這些綁腿巾綁起來。

gloss: 做<完成貌>-使役<完成貌>在-家
free: #e She left in the night, because she was chased away by her in-laws.
#c 她夜夜趕走，因為她被趕走被公公婆婆。
#e She went into the deep night.
#c 她進入深夜了。
#e “I don’t know, what will become of me.”
#c ”我不知道，我會變成怎麼樣。“
#e She was thinking, “I can’t go back to my elderly home? I will be shamed, because they will all know I was chased away.”
#c 她想說，“我不可能要回家？我會羞恥，因為人家會知道我是休妻的。”
#e She was on the road until dawn broke.
#c 她在路上過夜一直到天亮。

gloss: 做<完成貌>-使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.斜格
free: #e That girl’s parents were coming over to her in-laws’ house, to help out, because they were busy.
#c 那個孩子的爸爸媽媽想要拜訪娶她當媳婦的人親家，也想要幫助，因為很忙碌辛苦。

gloss: 做<完成貌>-使役<完成貌>在-家=處焦=遠距.斜格
free: #e They arrived at the in-laws’ house.
#c 他們到了親家。
#n kalumah is meant here as ku-lumah

gloss: 擁有-做<完成貌>-使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.斜格
主焦-動-路=改變狀態=斜格
free: #e He said, “didn’t your daughter get back home yesterday?”
#c 他說，“你的女兒不是昨天回去的嗎？”
#e She went away, we chased her off, because she was of no use.
#c 她走了，我們把她趕走了，他沒辦法使用。
#e She was at home, because she can’t work.
#c 她在這個家，不能工作。
#e We asked her to go home.
#c 我們叫她回娘家。
#e When the mother heard about this, she became very sad.
#c 當時媽媽聽到，她的心難過了。
#e “But she didn’t get back home!”
#c “可是沒有到家啊。”
#e Her daughter did not make it back home.
#c 她女孩子沒有到娘家。
#n nau’az or nauaz?
#e So they went back on the road.
#c 然後他們回去，在路上。
#e When they had reached the halfway mark, while climbing on the mountain, they saw,
#c 她看到，走到半路，爬上山，而在路中的時候。
#e She saw, how come these shin pads that are so similar to hers are falling down here?
#c 她看見說，怎麼會有個很像綁腿巾掉下來。
#e They almost seemed to be blown down from above.
#c 從上面很好像被風吹下來。
#e And they fell in front of the mother’s feet.
#c 落到媽媽的眼前。
#e When they took a better look at them, oh, they resembled the daughter’s shin pads a lot.
#c 當他們看的時候，哎好像，是屬於女兒的綁腿巾。
#e Because when she was getting married,
#c 因為當時假如小孩子被娶的時候，
#e The mother had made these shin pads for her.
#c 媽媽一定有縫過她的綁腿巾。
#e and had given her the traditional Bunun clothes to wear.
#c 布農族傳統服裝給她帶的。
#e The mother saw what came falling down had been sewn by her before.
#c 媽媽看到掉下來的是她之前縫過的。
#e She recognized immediately, this was her sewing work.
#c 她馬上知道，這是我縫過的。
#e These are the shin pads I gave my daughter.
#c 這是我送給女兒的綁腿巾。
#e They picked it up, the mother studied and, oh my god, they were here shin pads.
#c 他們拿起來了，媽媽觀察，哎呀，真的是我的綁腿巾。
#e She looked up to see where it fell from?
#c 她抬頭看從哪裏掉下來的？
#e Why is like this, where is she?
#c 為什麼這樣，她到底在哪裡了？
#e They really are my daughter’s shin pads.
#c 真真的是我的孩子所縫的綁腿巾的。
#e She kept calling for her child, but there was no response, nor did she see her.
#c 她一直叫她的孩子，可是沒有被回答，也沒有看到。
#e She was on the top of the mountain, and kept on calling: where are you? where are you?
#c 她在山頂一直叫，你在哪裡了？你在哪裡了？
#e Come, come out! I will take you home!
#c 來！出來！我就要帶你回家！
#n kuas =ku-kasu
#e The mother kept calling like that for her child.
#c 媽媽在那邊這樣的一直哭，一直叫孩子。
#e All of a sudden there was a voice coming from a tree: “Only a whisper remains, only a whisper remains.”
#c 突然樹上有叫聲說：“只剩一口氣，只剩一口氣。”
#e That’s what the mother heard.
#c 有這樣的聲音被媽媽聽到的。
#e The mother looked up — it sounds as if it’s her child who’s calling.
#c 媽媽抬頭看到，好像是媽媽的孩子的聲音一直在叫。
#e She said: where are you my child, come out, come out!
#c 她說：孩子你在哪裡了，出來吧，過來吧！
#e I am your mother.
#c 我是你的媽媽。

gloss: 非實現=帶-受焦=1SG.屬格=3SG.斜格
free: #e I will take you home.
#c 我要帶你會家。
#e The child answered: Only a whisper remains, only a whisper remains.
#c 孩子回答說：只剩一口氣，只剩一口氣。
#e The mother lifted her head, and saw a bird in the trees.
#c 媽媽抬頭看到樹上有一隻鳥。
#e It kept on calling, “only a whisper, only a whisper remains”.
#c 一直叫，只剩下說，只剩下一口氣。
#e Only a whisp remains, only a whisp remains.
#c 只剩下喉嚨的音，只剩下喉嚨的音。
#e It turns out she meant that she didn’t have any strength left to go home.
#c 原來她的意思要說，我已經沒有力氣，可以回家了。
#e Only a whisp of my strength remains.
#c 我的氣只剩下在喉嚨的音。
#e The mother looked up and saw that she had become a bird, and kept on calling in the tree, only a whisp remained.
#c 媽媽抬頭看到，她就變成鳥，在樹上面一直叫，只剩下喉嚨的一口氣。
#e After the bird [she] became a bird,
#c 那隻鳥變成了鳥之後，
#e the mother was sad and went home, but…
#c 媽媽難過回到家裡，可是??

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.主格

free: #e Up until now, that daughter-in-law that had become a bird is being called the “lapus ‘ang’ang” by the Bunun people.
#c 到現在那個以前的媳婦變成現在鳥，被布農族叫做 “lapus ‘ang’ang”
#e This kind of bird is still in the woods.
#c 有這隻鳥在山上。
#e If people go into the woods on the mountains, they will hear that kind of birdcall, “lapus ‘ang’ang, lapus ‘ang’ang."
#c 如果人去山上的森林的話，就會聽得到這樣的鳥叫聲，一直叫“lapus ‘ang’ang, lapus ‘ang’ang”。
#e The Bunun people gave it the name “Lapus ‘ang’ang” .
#c 牠從布農族收到“lapus ‘ang’ang”的鳥的命名。

gloss: 使役<完成貌>在-家=遠距.斜格

free: #e In the beginning, it was the daughter-in-law that had been chased away, and then became a bird.
#c 過去本來是媳婦被休妻，所以變成了鳥。
#e The end.
#c 結束了。
